name: Okura and Sakura Shrimp Japanese-Style Spaghetti
author: Kurumi
summary: Have you ever eaten Japanese-style spaghetti? It's seasoned with soy sauce, mirin, and sake. Let's enjoy Japanese taste!
ingredients: 1  red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
8 pods okra, cut into bite-sized pieces
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes
Drain, reserving 3 tablespoons of the cooking water
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium-low heat
Cook and stir red bell pepper in the hot oil until softened, about 5 minutes
Stir in okra, soy sauce, sake, and mirin; cook for 1 minute
Stir cooked spaghetti, reserved cooking water, and remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil into the skillet
Mix in half of the shrimp; cook for 1 minute
Scoop spaghetti mixture into a bowl
